meanings.definition: Resembling a river in appearance or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The winding path through the park was so riverlike, with twists and turns.
meanings.sent2: The stream flowed gently, creating a riverlike atmosphere in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The way the ribbon curled on the gift was so riverlike, it seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back in a riverlike fashion, smooth and continuous.
meanings.sent5: The rows of corn in the field swayed in a riverlike motion, as if dancing to an invisible tune.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics or qualities of a river.
meanings.sent1: The expansive lake had a riverlike flow, moving steadily from one end to the other.
meanings.sent2: The boat glided effortlessly on the riverlike surface of the calm lake.
meanings.sent3: The way the children lined up for recess was riverlike, each one following the other in a continuous stream.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a riverlike quality, soothing and calming to all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The city streets were filled with a riverlike crowd, flowing in one direction like a human current.
